summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Health Services intake screening form for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, conducted on July 6, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM). It documents his medical history, vital signs, and initial health assessment shortly after his arrest, noting elevated blood pressure and ordering follow-up tests.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein

events.title: Epstein's BOP Medical Intake Screening
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein undergoes a comprehensive health screening at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, including medical history, vital signs, and lab orders.

events.title: Medical Note Cosignature
events.description: An MD cosigns and reviews the medical intake documentation completed by the PA-C for Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Paris (mentioned as travel location prior to arrest)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's medical intake occurred on July 6, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, shortly after his arrest.
Epstein reported having 10+ female sexual partners in the last 5 years, sometimes using condoms, and a history of treated chlamydia in 2015.
Epstein denied any history of physical, emotional, or sexual abuse, and denied any history of mental health treatment or suicide attempts.
Vital signs showed elevated blood pressure (164/90, 155/83), leading to orders for follow-up BP checks, an EKG, and lab tests including a lipid profile and metabolic panel.
Epstein reported traveling to Paris for three weeks prior to his arrest and identified his occupation as a banker.
